comment._content: Would help if an approximate date of photo was given and location.

comment.author: 26887305@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/motleypixel]  I do know they add annotations on photos where some detail was added to them, so I guess they probably would have done so here as well. The styles (lapels, ties, collars, children haircuts) match what I think would be 1920s. What are they welcoming? Who knows.

comment.author: 38714066@N00
comment._content: I'd bet the bottom line says 'Kiwanis Club'.

comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content:
This is a photo of Army Air Service aviators John Macready and Oakley G. Kelly apparently celebrating their non-stop flight in a Fokker T-2 from Roosevelt Field, Long Island to Rockwell Field, Sand Diego.

Here's another apparently contemporaneous photo of Macready and Kelly in the SDASM Flickr photostream:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/8091748581/]
